revised_title: Skeletal Growth and Development Inhibition in Creeper Fowl Embryos
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on skeletal growth and development in vitro to understand the effects of the Creeper mutation on avian phokomelia. They found that growth retardation inhibited cartilage differentiation and ossification in early stages of development, but not in later stages. This study provided insights into the critical periods of development and the factors affecting skeletal growth.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
